spec.name: Rosa Building
spec.description: The Rosa Building (Immeuble Rosa) is a historical residential and commercial structure, constructed between 1932 and 1937 and designed by Italian architect **Aldo Manassi**. It is a major example of the Italian Art Deco influence in Casablanca's central district, known for its monumental symmetry and decorative detailing. The building's importance was recognized by its designation as a **National Material Patrimony** site in 2018.

people.comment: Italian architect who designed the building.

timeline.title: National Material Patrimony Declaration
timeline.description: The building was officially included in the National Material Patrimony of Morocco.

access.comment: Building is inhabited; exterior view is public, interior access is restricted to residents/tenants.
